title: General Training Set 17 — Community Garden & Digital Payments
description: Semi-formal letter about starting a neighbourhood garden and an essay debating a cashless society.

task1.title: Letter to a residents' association
task1.prompt: You live in an apartment complex that has an unused courtyard. Write a letter to the residents' association proposing the creation of a community vegetable garden. In your letter: describe why the space is currently unused, explain how the garden would benefit residents, and outline how you plan to organise volunteers.
hints: Use a polite and persuasive tone suitable for a residents' committee.
Include practical steps for maintaining the garden.
Address potential concerns such as cost or noise.

task2.title: Discussion essay — Moving towards a cashless society
task2.prompt: Some people believe that replacing cash with digital payments will benefit individuals and businesses, while others worry about privacy and accessibility. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
outline: Introduction: introduce the topic and state that you will discuss both perspectives.
Body paragraph 1: explain reasons why cashless payments can be advantageous.
Body paragraph 2: explore concerns about privacy, security, and inclusion.
Conclusion: present your opinion and suggest how to balance innovation with safeguards.
